name: 3D Anatomy Atlas
description:
Repository of 3D anatomy models to study and visualize parts of the body in an intuitive way.

It should be intuitive enough that I don't need to explain how it works, but if you have any questions feel free to ask me.

- Note: If you want to search for a body part, its corresponding system must be active.
- Note 2:       Left click -> Move       Right click-> Rotate       Scroll Wheel->Zoom

It will be a free and open source app for all the platforms (Android, iOS, WebGL, Windows, etc).
Actually, it's designed to be a mobile app, but the UI fits any resolution.

The names and definitions of the body parts are in English and Spanish. Spanish are translated with an online translator, so there will be some errors. However, it will be manually translated into a few languages in the future.

You can find the open source models on the following link (Z-Anatomy, Gauthier Kervyn): https://www.z-anatomy.com/
If you found his awesome job useful, please consider thanking him with a donation:
https://liberapay.com/GauthierKERVYN/donate

This project will be constantly updated.
I appreciate any suggestions to improve the application.

*This is the first public pre-alpha.
